definition: many things waiting to be done (idiom)/a thousand things to do
surname Bai
hundred/numerous/all kinds of
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
variant of 廢|废[fei4]/disabled
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
to stay
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
surname Xing

sentences.english: Angola is under its post-war reconstruction with everything waiting to be taken up.
sentences.chinese: 安哥拉正在进行战后重建工作，百废待兴。

sentences.english: This is a new era and we all start from scratch.
sentences.chinese: 我们百废待兴，这是一个新的时代。

sentences.english: Engineers would be needed to rebuild his devastated country, he concluded.
sentences.chinese: 他悟出，人们需要工程师来重建百废待兴的祖国。

sentences.english: In 1981, reform and opening up, torn, and every trade has to be done.
sentences.chinese: 1981年处于改革开放初期，百废待兴，百业待举。

definition: many things waiting to be done (idiom)/a thousand things to do
all neglected tasks are being undertaken (idiom)/work is now underway
the people's livelihood is reduced to destitution (idiom); a time of famine and impoverishment
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
a thousand things remain to be done (idiom)/numerous tasks remain to be undertaken
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
turmoil/upheaval/unrest
The people have no way to make a living (idiom, from Record of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4])/no way of getting by
chaos of war
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
to found a country/nation-building/the foundation of PRC by Mao Zedong in 1949
economic depression
(idiom) flourishing/thriving
peace and prosperity (idiom)
incessant fighting between warlords
a nation's power
